post.title: Looking Back 60 Years
post.author: abelgaxiola
post.content:
Today I’m 60 year’s old and not really excited about it but looking back and thinking about what has happened in my life time makes me feel – how can I say it – old and special.  Now, I know that I’m not old in the sense of being: really old (my own biased opinion).  But one thing’s for sure: I’m no spring chicken.  So what’s special about having lived 60 years you might ask? Well here’s a short list of things that I have seen, experienced, and/or been a part of:

1.    The social revolution or the counterculture movement as some might refer to it.
2.    The Vietnam War and the anti-war demonstrations.
3.    The Cultural Revolution in China.
4.    Student and worker uprisings in France.
5.    The massacre of Tlatelolco (in Mexico City).
6.    The assassinations of John F. Kennedy and that of his brother Robert F. Kennedy.
7.    Civil Right Movement and the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr.
8.    Viva la Raza and Chicano Movement.
9.    Space exploration and the landing of the first man on the moon.
10.    Woodstock.
11.    The Iranian Revolution
12.    The Munich massacre.
13.    Watergate.
14.    Oil crisis of the 70’s.
15.    Kent state shootings.
16.    Bell-bottomed pants.
17.    Personal Computers and video games.
18.    9-11 and the ramifications such as two Gulf wars and the war in Afghanistan.
19.    Breakup of Yugoslavia.
20.    End of the Soviet Union and the Berlin Wall.
21.    Hand held computers: smart phones and tablets.

Missing are many other events some of which are currently taking place such as the war on drugs, the violence in Mexico, the war on terror, the economy and the state of the political process in America.  Also missing are the many great movies, music, and television programs that had a great influence in the shaping of the culture. 

Today I’m grateful to have survived it all; and happy to be surrounded by people that love me such as my wife and family.  First phone call I received this morning was my granddaughter singing me happy birthday.  I’m looking forward for whatever the future holds.  In the meantime, I’m enjoying the moment. 

What a great day this is…
